direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the Iterator interface and work together to manage the iteration process.
Both methods handle the logic of finding the next node in the iteration process, sharing similar control flow and exception handling.
The next method relies on findNextNode to locate the next node in the iteration, indicating a strong dependency.
The restart method can be used to reset the iterator, which is similar to the next method's role in advancing the iterator.
Both methods are part of the Iterator interface and manage the state of the iterated nodes, though they perform different operations.
